translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses🔽The Chapter with Khattiyas

analyzed: yasavatī pamukha aṭṭhārasa bhikkhunī sahassa apadāna
translated: The Story of the Eighteen Thousand Nuns with Yasavatī as their Head

analyzed: bhavā sabbe parikkhīṇā  bhavā santi vimocitā
translated: “All our existences are exhausted,🔽we are freed from all future existences;
We have no more defilements,

original: ārocema mahāmune.🔽Purimaṁ kusalaṁ kammaṁ,🔽yaṁ kiñci sādhupatthitaṁ;
analyzed: ārocema mahā mune  purimam kusalam kamma  yam kiñci
translated: we announce this to you, great sage.🔽Any good deeds we have done in the past,🔽whatever we have done well,
we have given for your enjoyment,
for you, great sage.
For the Buddhas and the Independent Buddhas,
and for their disciples,
we have given for their enjoyment,

analyzed: tuyhatthāya mahā mune  ucca nīca mayam kamma  bhikkhūnam sādhu patthita
translated: for you, great sage.🔽The high and low deeds we have done,🔽well done for the monks,
the high and low service we have done,
this we have done for you, great sage.

analyzed: tena iva sukka mūlena  coditā kamma sampadā
translated: By that very root of merit,🔽impelled by the perfection of our deeds,
we were reborn in a high family,
beyond the human state.
When the deed was done,
or even at the time of birth,
in the end we were born together,
as Khattiyas, born into a high family.
We were beautiful and wealthy,
honoured with gain and respect;
In the inner palace, great hero,
like the gods in Nandana.
Having become dispassionate,
we went forth from the home life;
After a few days

analyzed: sabbā pattāmha nibbuti  cīvaram piṇḍapātam ca  paccayam sayana āsana
translated: we all attained nibbāna.
Many people give us🔽robes, almsfood, requisites, and lodgings,
always honoring and respecting us.
Our defilements are burned away,
all our existences are destroyed;
like a nāga that has cut its tethers,
we live without pollutants.
How welcome it was for us
to come into the presence of the Buddha!
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations as well,
the six direct knowledges have been realized;
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the nuns Yasavatī and the other eighteen thousand nuns, in the presence of the Buddha, recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ yasavatīpamukhāni khattiyakaññābhikkhuniyo aṭṭhārasasahassāni bhagavato sammukhā imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Yasavatīpamukhaaṭṭhārasabhikkhunīsahassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam yasavatī pamukhāni khattiya kaññā bhikkhuniyaḥ aṭṭhārasa sahassāni bhagavato sammukhā imā gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽yasavatī pamukha aṭṭhārasa bhikkhunī sahassa apadānam paṭhama
translated: The foundation stories of the eighteen thousand nuns headed by Yasavatī are finished.
